A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The Stars I give are for the fantastic art department. I had very few bones to pick with this movie in an aesthetic sense. The only things that bothered me were the TERRIBLE Porg puppets\, and horrendous looking Yoda. Yes\, I realized the rubber bits of him were molded from the original casts\, but the way it came out in the film looked cartoonish. \n\nIn a story sense\, this movie wasted so much potential. I won't bother repeating what everyone else has said\, but considering everything that was set up in The Force Awakens\, it's a shame that Rian Johnson was ironically too prideful to continue the story rather than do his own thing and essentially try to reboot the two-dimensional conflict from the original trilogy. Kylo had real depth\, and now he's a cartoonish rage monster all of a sudden. Rey\, FInn and Poe felt like they were taking a back seat to their own movie\, and the whole casino subplot was boring and unnecessary as shit.
